content: Which Shakespearean play tells the story of star-crossed lovers from feuding families in Verona, Italy?

That would be "Romeo and Juliet," one of Shakespeare's most famous tragedies. The play tells the story of two young lovers, Romeo Montague and Juliet Capulet, whose families are engaged in a bitter feud in the city of Verona. Despite the hostility between their families, Romeo and Juliet fall deeply in love, but their secret marriage leads to tragic consequences, ultimately resulting in their deaths. The play explores themes of love, hate, passion, and the consequences of violent conflict. It remains a timeless classic and has been adapted into numerous films, operas, ballets, and other forms of media over the centuries.
